document_title: Anal fistula – Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Anal fistula may present with symptoms including:
Pain and swelling around the anus; Bloody or foul-smelling discharge (pus) from a hole around the anus. The pain may decrease after the fistula has drained.; Skin irritation around the anus due to fluid leaking out; Pain during defecation; Anal bleeding.; The infection can cause fever, chills and a feeling of fatigue.
“When there are signs of suspected anal fistula as above, the patient needs to immediately go to the hospital for examination. Because the fistula progresses for a long time, it can become a complex fistula, meaning there are many different nooks and crannies, making it difficult to treat completely." - Dr. Thai recommended.
